Tucson nods.

" Very well.  Stay safe for me Talon.   I can't imagine exist=
ence without you."

For the most part Tucson played the part of a solid war=
rior but in truth he knew he needed Talon more than he realized.  His expre=
ssion changes again.   Stress had taken it's toll on him and now it was beg=
inning to show.  He wanted to scream his head off in the worst way but didn=
't know how.  The next best thing was to punch a fist through the wall. But=
 what would that solve?  The truth was the fact that even though he never a=
dmitted it, he needed support as much as anyone did but was far too stubbor=
n to ask for it.  He slowly falls to his knees, raking the claws on his han=
ds on the wall.  

" What is happening to me?  Why is this happening?  And =
why do I feel so out of control?  Leo, I - I can't -  I can't stabilize my =
mood.  Something is wrong, very wrong.  And I don't know how to stop it."

=
Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 22, 2011, at 8:37 PM,=
 Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Talon:
>  
> "the si=
tuation is stable"said the femme"Still waitting for the shuttle to traslate=
 the rest of the wounded"

=

> 
> Perpetually on the =
move and constantly busy. 
>

tstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

e, answer"said Talon by comlink
>  
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> From: ma=
gicquartz@...
> Date: Mon, 22 Aug 2011 19:10:52 -0400
> Subject: Re: =
Maximals - Ark Medbay
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson transforms into robot mode and quie=
tly sighs.
> 
> " I have made many mistakes.  Yes allowing Straight Shot to=
 stick up for herself looked wrong and you are right to question that.  But=
 why should it be wrong to defend one self against harassing ridicule?  I w=
ould not have stood for her behavior if I did not see a cause for her displ=
easure.  Master Yokitron would always remind me that discipline had to come=
 from the victim of wrong doing rather than outside reprimand in order to w=
ork effectively.  To you and others my methods are untraditional, and that =
is valid cause for concern.  Leo I am not like everyone else.  Even as an A=
utobot I was considered a somewhat renegade of the faction.  I thought well=
 off the pavement.  And I have a very unpredictable reputation.  I have not=
 lost that reputation Leo Prime.  And I am no means perfect.  And if revoki=
ng my leadership is what they are here to do then they have every right to =
do so.  I am not the average Maximal AKA Autobot.  I am too much of a rebel=
 and I do best on my own accord.  
> 
> He was ready for consequences as he=
 waits for Leo's reaction.
> 
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy=
. 
> 
> On Aug 22, 2011, at 5:48 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...=
m> wrote:
> 
>  
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson meets Leo Prime's expression with=
 an angry stare of his own. His
> > tail continues to snap in an agitated m=
anner yet he doesn't lash out in full
> > draconic fury, as it would seem.
=
> >
> > " I seriously hope you are not intending to undermine me Leo. "
> 
=
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME carefully said nothing as he waited for everyone to =
leave
> the room. He glanced over and saw QUICKSTRIDE coming in to check in=
 on
> UPROAR. With a deft movement LEO pushed a button closing off the side=

> of the medbay he was on from the side that QUICKSTRIDE and UPROAR were
>=
 on, and then darkned the lgass for privacy. If QUICKSTRIDE wanted to
> lea=
ve there was a secondary door for that.
> 
> Finally LEO turned to TUSCON a=
s he folded his arms behind his back.
> TUSCON was larger than LEO, and yet=
 there was no fear in LEO's optics
> as he carefully examined him, noting t=
he changes that have occured
> because of his new beast mode.
> 
> "Undermi=
ne you?" LEO PRIME said finally, his voice neutral and yet a
> curious lilt=
 to it. "You allowed your subordinates, your family as you
> say, to intent=
ionally try to harm another Maximal or Autobot." He
> paused as he shifted =
his gaze to the map of the jungle scene for a
> moment. "Under normal circu=
mstances that would be automatic
> disciplinary action. An assault on a fel=
low soldier and you allowed
> it?"
> 
> While LEO PRIME's voice was low, th=
ere was a controlled power in it,
> an anger of his own held in powerful ch=
eck. "The council has not sent
> a single mech to ancient Earth in years, a=
nd now all of a sudden you
> get nine?" He tilted his head as he watched fo=
r changes in expression,
> "Have you any idea why that might be?"
> 
> (TAG=
)
> 
> Preston
